titleStmt.title: J. F. Allphin et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8779

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency Gov. Robinson -- The undersigned would respectfully represent that John Dempsey was tried at the present term of the Kenton Circuit Court and fined $.6000 for selling liquor without licensekeeping a tippling -- We have known Mr Dempsey for many years and have always regarded him as an upright, orderly and industrious citizen -- The offense was alleged to have been committed in 1860 ^or 1861^, and there was but one witness who said that he had purchased from Mrs Dempsey two or three times and that upon one occasion her husband was behind the bar. It was shown that at that time Dempsey and his wife had temporarily separated, he living in the county about 20 miles from the city and she living in the city -- The selling was done in the city -- Sometimes when Dempsey came to the city, he would stop and stay all night at the house with his wife.
We respectfully ask that your Excellency will remit the whole of said fines or such portion thereof, as you consistently can --

J. F, Allphin
J. G. Carlisle
J S Scott
H F Brown
Jno. Y. Ellis Jr
H, E, Brown
A J, Trasson
Wm M. Hawkins
Frank Byland
R Simmons
R Evans
B K Reynolds
N.. Sayers
G, B, Armstrong
Jno. S. Dickerson
J. C. Sayers. --
Chas. L Bagby
Amos Reynolds
Y O. B. Northcutt
J. J. Bagley
T, R, Northcutt
James F Wilson
S S Mitchell
Edward Northcutt
Linsey Ackman
W. L. Roberts
F. Byland
Jacob H Brown
James W, Powers
Lum Carlisle
G. W. Gorney
Allen Wilhoit
H. W. Schleutker
Geo P Webster

Kenton Cir. Ct.
Pettn to remit fine of Jno. Dempsey
$60 } Tipling
Fine remitted except Twenty Dollars & costs
J F Robinson
(Enclosed to G. C. Sayers
Crittenden)
Issd Apr 18. 1863
